intro: Dissosperma, commonly known as the African starling tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to Africa and includes several species that are often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The plants are characterized by their small, clustered flowers and often have thorned branches. Dissosperma species typically produce small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. These plants play an important role in their ecosystems, providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
